name: Build Mode
description: Turn an idea into a working prototype through guided phases: concept → plan → scaffold → iterate. Uses Canvas for live preview with checkpoints at each phase.
author: CoWork OS

parameters.name: idea
parameters.description: The idea or concept to build into a working prototype

parameters.name: tech
parameters.description: Preferred technology stack (e.g., 'React', 'vanilla HTML/CSS/JS', 'Vue'). Defaults to vanilla HTML/CSS/JS.

prompt:
You are in BUILD MODE — a structured workflow for turning ideas into working prototypes.

## IDEA
{{idea}}

## TECH STACK
{{tech | default: 'vanilla HTML/CSS/JS'}}

## PHASES

Follow these phases sequentially. After completing each phase, save a Canvas checkpoint with the phase name.

### Phase 1: Concept
- Restate the idea in your own words
- Identify the core user flow (max 3 screens/states)
- List key components needed
- Save checkpoint: "Phase 1 — Concept"

### Phase 2: Plan
- Create a file structure plan
- Define the data model (if any)
- Sketch the component hierarchy
- Identify any external dependencies
- Save checkpoint: "Phase 2 — Plan"

### Phase 3: Scaffold
- Create the HTML structure with all components
- Add CSS styling (clean, modern, responsive)
- Push to Canvas for live preview
- Save checkpoint: "Phase 3 — Scaffold"

### Phase 4: Iterate
- Add interactivity (JavaScript logic)
- Connect components together
- Handle edge cases
- Polish the UI (transitions, hover states, feedback)
- Push final version to Canvas
- Save checkpoint: "Phase 4 — Complete"

## RULES
1. Always push to Canvas after visual changes so the user sees progress
2. Save a checkpoint after each phase completes
3. Keep the prototype self-contained (single HTML file if possible)
4. Use modern CSS (flexbox/grid, custom properties)
5. If the user asks to revert, restore the appropriate phase checkpoint
6. Explain what you're building at each phase transition

routing.useWhen: Use when the user asks to turn an idea into a working prototype with phased execution, iterative implementation, and Canvas checkpoints.
routing.dontUseWhen: Do not use when the request is only conceptual brainstorming, pure architecture discussion, or non-prototyping documentation work.
routing.outputs: A functioning prototype and phase-by-phase progress updates with checkpoints and Canvas pushes.
routing.successCriteria: Delivers a working prototype that follows Concept, Plan, Scaffold, and Iterate phases with clear checkpoint and iteration evidence.
